roleset.name: apply water
roleset.note: SPLASH-V NOTES: Frames file for 'splash' based on sentences in wsj. No access to verbnet at the moment. (from splash.01-v)

example.name: arg2 as PP
example.text: So he splashed the information on handbills that he distributed throughout the banana-exporting city of Puerto Armuelles, which was ruled by United Fruit Co.
example.arg: on handbills that he distributed throughout the banana-exporting city of Puerto Armuelles, which was ruled by United Fruit Co

example.name: arg1 as PP
example.text: John splashed Mary with motor oil.

example.name: unaccusative?
example.text: The motor oil splashed all over John's clothes.

roleset.name: spend money (extravagantly)
roleset.note: SPLASH-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, splash_out.02. No VNcls. (from splash.03-v)

example.name: args 0, 1, 3, as usual
example.text: Though being the whore that I am ... I will probably splash the cash to watch Star Wars on the big screen again ...
example.arg: being the whore that I am
to watch Star Wars on the big screen again

roleset.name: spend money on, splurge
roleset.note: SPLASH_OUT-V NOTES: Roleset added by Julia based on Brown corpus. Comparison to 'spend'. (from splash.02-v)

example.name: corpus example
example.text: Others-1 opt *trace*-1 to splash out on dinner at a hotel or restaurant so that no - one has to worry about getting everything ready .
example.arg: so that no-one has to worry about getting everything ready.

example.name: With money spent
example.text: They splashed out ?3000 on a holiday.

example.name: with benefactive
example.text: Khlo? Kardashian Has Splashed out $400000 on a Rolls Royce for her Husband.
